WorkItem.ClosedComment: Fixed for next release. As a workaround try closing optimizer first, reopening and then do optimize.
WorkItem.Description:
I was running an optimize on it after adding Alchemy and Leatherworking professions, and tossing in a Runed Band of the Kirin Tor to see what changes I would have to make to my stuffz.
 
Character file attached
 
just-in-time (JIT) debugging instead of this dialog box.
 
************** Exception Text **************
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at Rawr.Optimizer.ItemInstanceOptimizer.GetCalculationsValue(Character character, CharacterCalculationsBase calcs, String calculation, List`1 requirements, Single& nonJewelerValue)
   at Rawr.Optimizer.ItemInstanceOptimizer.GetOptimizationValue(Character character, CharacterCalculationsBase valuation)
   at Rawr.Optimizer.ItemInstanceOptimizer.OptimizeCharacterThreadStart(Character character, String calculationToOptimize, List`1 requirements, Int32 thoroughness, Boolean injectCharacter)
WorkItem.Summary: [Optimizer] Unhandled Exception at end of Optimize

Comments.Message: I had the same issue. I selected my professions (Enchanting and Tailoring) and tried to run the optimizer but it would give me an error at the end each time and wouldn't optimize.

I have the same exact error. I load my character from the armory, added Alchemy and Enchanting for professions, then tried to run the optimizer. At the very end of the optimizer I got the same error noted above.
